1913def main():
1914    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(
1915        description="CTD Fjorder Processing Script",
1916        formatter_class=argparse.RawTextHelpFormatter
1917    )
1918    subparsers = parser.add_subparsers(dest='command', required=True)
1919
1920    # Subparser for the 'merge' command
1921    parser_merge = subparsers.add_parser('merge', help='Merge all RSK files in the current folder')
1922    parser_merge.add_argument("-v", "--verbose", help="increase output verbosity", action="store_true")
1923
1924    # Subparser for the 'default' command
1925    parser_default = subparsers.add_parser('default', help='Run the default processing pipeline')
1926    parser_default.add_argument('-p', '--plot', action='store_true',
1927                                help='Generate plots during the default processing pipeline')
1928    parser_default.add_argument("-v", "--verbose", help="Increase output verbosity", action="store_true")
1929    parser_default.add_argument("-r", "--reset", help="Resets file environment (DELETES FILES)",
1930                                action="store_true")
1931    parser_default.add_argument('-o', '--output', type=str, help='Path to output file')
1932    parser_default.add_argument('-m', '--mastersheet', type=str, help='Path to mastersheet')
1933    parser_default.add_argument('-w', '--workers', type=int, nargs='?', const=1, help='Sets max workers for parallel processing')
1934    args = parser.parse_args()
1935
1936    if args.command == 'merge':
1937        if args.verbose:
1938            logger.setLevel(logging.INFO)
1939        merge_all_in_folder()
1940        print("Merging completed successfully.")
1941
1942    elif args.command == 'default':
1943        if args.verbose:
1944            logger.setLevel(logging.INFO)
1945        else:
1946            logger.setLevel(logging.FATAL)
1947        if args.reset:
1948            _reset_file_environment()
1949        if not args.mastersheet:
1950            run_default(plot=args.plot, max_workers=args.workers)
1951        else:
1952            run_default(plot=args.plot, master_sheet_path=args.mastersheet, max_workers=args.workers)
1953        if args.plot:
1954            print("Default processing with plotting completed successfully.")
1955        else:
1956            print("Default processing completed successfully.")
1957    sys.exit(1)
1958
1959
1960if __name__ == '__main__':
1961    main()
class CTD: 
  47class CTD:
  48    """
  49    CTD
  50    ---
  51
  52    Class representing a CTD object for processing and analyzing CTD data.
  53
  54    Attributes
  55    ----------
  56    master_sheet_path : str
  57        Path to the mastersheet.
  58
  59    Usage
  60    -----
  61    To create a CTD object for custom pipelines use the following method:
  62
  63    >>> my_data = CTD("example.rsk")
  64
  65    You can then run a CTD command on it like removing non-postive sample rows and then viewing your table
  66
  67    >>> my_data.remove_non_positive_samples()
  68    >>> my_data.view_table()
  69
  70    Notes
  71    -----
  72    - Filenames must match a correct date, or else in instances where the mastersheet
  73    must be consulted CTDFjorder will return an error.
  74
  75    """
  76    _ctd_array = pandas.DataFrame()
  77    _rsk = None
  78    _filename = None
  79    _calculator = None
  80    _cwd = None
  81    _cached_master_sheet = pandas.DataFrame()
  82    _original_profile = None
  83    master_sheet_path = None
  84    _NO_SAMPLES_ERROR = "No samples in file."
  85    _NO_LOCATION_ERROR = "No location could be found."
  86    _DENSITY_CALCULATION_ERROR = "Could not calculate density on this dataset."
  87    _SALINITYABS_CALCULATION_ERROR = "Could not calculate salinity on this dataset."
  88    _DATA_CLEANING_ERROR = "No data remains after data cleaning, reverting to previous CTD"
  89    _REMOVE_NEGATIVES_ERROR = "No data remains after removing non-positive samples."
  90    _MLD_ERROR = "No data remains after calculating MLD."
  91    _NO_MASTER_SHEET_ERROR = ("No mastersheet provided. Cannot geolocate file, try using find_master_sheet_file " +
  92                             "before this step.")
  93    _rsk_file_flag = False
  94
  95    def __init__(self, ctdfilepath, cached_master_sheet=pandas.DataFrame(), master_sheet_path = None):
  96        """
  97        Initialize a new CTD object.
  98
  99        Parameters
 100        ----------
 101        ctdfilepath : str
 102            The file path to the RSK or Castaway file.
 103        """
 104        if not cached_master_sheet.empty:
 105            self._cached_master_sheet = cached_master_sheet
 106        if "rsk" in ctdfilepath:
 107            self._rsk_file_flag = True
 108            self._rsk = RSK(ctdfilepath)
 109            self._filename = ('_'.join(ctdfilepath.split("/")[-1].split("_")[0:3]).split(".rsk")[0])
 110            num_profiles = sum(1 for _ in self._rsk.profiles())
 111            rsk_downcast_times = self._rsk.casts(Region.CAST_DOWN)
 112            if num_profiles < 1:
 113                self._ctd_array = np.array(self._rsk.npsamples())
 114            else:
 115                region = next(rsk_downcast_times)
 116                start_time = region.start_time
 117                end_time = region.end_time
 118                try:
 119                    self._ctd_array = np.array(self._rsk.npsamples(start_time, end_time))
 120                except Exception:
 121                    raise CTDError(self._filename, "No downcasts in file.")
 122            self._ctd_array = pd.DataFrame(self._ctd_array)
 123            self._original_profile = pd.DataFrame(self._ctd_array)
 124        else:
 125            self._rsk_file_flag = False
 126            self._filename = ('_'.join(ctdfilepath.split("/")[-1].split("_")[0:3]).split(".csv")[0])
 127            utc_cast_time = self.Utility.extract_utc_cast_time(ctdfilepath=ctdfilepath)
 128            latitude, longitude = self.Utility.extract_lat_long_castaway(ctdfilepath=ctdfilepath)
 129            try:
 130                latitude = float(latitude)
 131                longitude = float(longitude)
 132            except:
 133                latitude = None
 134                longitude = None
 135            # Convert UTC cast time to datetime and create timestamp column
 136            start_time = pd.to_datetime(utc_cast_time)
 137            # Calculate the time increments for each row
 138            pd_csv_castaway = pd.read_csv(ctdfilepath, comment='%')
 139            timestamps = [start_time + pd.Timedelta(seconds=0.2 * i) for i in range(len(pd_csv_castaway))]
 140            header_mapping = {
 141                "Pressure (Decibar)": "seapressure_00",
 142                "Depth (Meter)": "depth_00",
 143                "Temperature (Celsius)": "temperature_00",
 144                "Conductivity (MicroSiemens per Centimeter)": "conductivity_00",
 145                "Specific conductance (MicroSiemens per Centimeter)": "specificconductivity_00",
 146                "Salinity (Practical Salinity Scale)": "salinity_00",
 147                "Sound velocity (Meters per Second)": "speedofsound_00",
 148                "latitude": "latitude",
 149                "longitude": "longitude"
 150            }
 151            pd_csv_castaway.rename(columns=header_mapping, inplace=True)
 152            # Insert the timestamp column as the first column
 153            pd_csv_castaway['pressure_00'] = pd_csv_castaway['seapressure_00']
 154            pd_csv_castaway['pressure_00'] += 10
 155            pd_csv_castaway['conductivity_00'] /= 1000
 156            pd_csv_castaway.insert(0, 'timestamp', timestamps)
 157            pd_csv_castaway = pd_csv_castaway.assign(latitude=latitude)
 158            pd_csv_castaway = pd_csv_castaway.assign(longitude=longitude)
 159            pd_csv_castaway.drop('Density (Kilograms per Cubic Meter)', axis=1, inplace=True)
 160            self._ctd_array = pd_csv_castaway
 161            self._original_profile = pd_csv_castaway.copy(deep=True)
 162        self.Utility = self.Utility(self._filename)
 163        self._cwd = _get_cwd()
 164        self.master_sheet_path = master_sheet_path
 165        self._cached_master_sheet=cached_master_sheet
 166        logger.info("New CTD Object Created from : " + self._filename)
 167
 168    def find_master_sheet_file(self):
 169        """
 170        Function to find and the master sheet path. Uses the first xlsx file in the current working directory.
 171        """
 172        cwd = _get_cwd()
 173        xlsx_files = [file for file in os.listdir(cwd) if file.endswith(".xlsx")]
 174        if len(xlsx_files) > 0:
 175            self.master_sheet_path = os.path.abspath(xlsx_files[0])

 177    def view_table(self):
 178        """
 179        Print the CTD data table.
 180        """
 181        print(tabulate(self._ctd_array, headers='keys', tablefmt='psql'))
 182
 183    def get_pandas_df(self, copy=True):
 184        """
 185        Exposes the dataframe of the CTD object for custom processes.
 186
 187        Parameters
 188        ----------
 189        copy : bool, optional
 190            If True returns a copy, if False returns the actual DataFrame internal to the CTD object. Defaults to True.
 191
 192        Returns
 193        -------
 194        DataFrame
 195            The pandas df of the CTD object.
 196        """
 197        return self._ctd_array.copy() if copy is True else self._ctd_array
 198
 199    def add_filename_to_table(self):
 200        """
 201        Add the filename to the CTD data table.
 202        """
 203        self._ctd_array = self._ctd_array.assign(filename=self._filename)
 204
 205    def remove_timezone_indicator(self):
 206        """
 207        Removes the timezone indicator in the CTD data table 'timestamp' column.
 208        """
 209        self._ctd_array = self.Utility.remove_sample_timezone_indicator(self._ctd_array)
 210
 211    def add_location_to_table(self):
 212        """
 213        Retrieves the sample location data from the RSK file and adds it to the CTD data table.
 214        If no location data is found, it attempts to estimate the location using the master sheet.
 215        """
 216        # Check if file is castaway
 217        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
 218            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_SAMPLES_ERROR)
 219        if not self._rsk_file_flag:
 220            if self._ctd_array.latitude[0] == '':
 221                if self.master_sheet_path is None:
 222                    raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_MASTER_SHEET_ERROR)
 223                else:
 224                    location_data = self._process_master_sheet(self.master_sheet_path, self._filename)
 225            else:
 226                return
 227        # Process RSK file
 228        else:
 229            location_data = self.get_sample_location(self._rsk, self._filename)
 230        try:
 231            self._ctd_array = self._ctd_array.assign(latitude=location_data[0],
 232                                                     longitude=location_data[1])
 233        except Exception:
 234            self._ctd_array.loc['latitude'] = None
 235            self._ctd_array.loc['longitude'] = None
 236            self._ctd_array.loc['filename'] = None
 237            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_LOCATION_ERROR)
 238
 239    def remove_upcasts(self):
 240        """
 241        Removes upcasts based on the rate of change of pressure over time.
 242        This function calculates the vertical speed of the system through the water
 243        using the derivative of pressure with respect to time. It filters out data
 244        collected in the air or while stationary at the surface or bottom, and
 245        separates the downcasts from upcasts.
 246        """
 247        # Ensure 'timestamp' is a datetime object for correct differentiation
 248        if not pd.api.types.is_datetime64_any_dtype(self._ctd_array['timestamp']):
 249            self._ctd_array['timestamp'] = pd.to_datetime(self._ctd_array['timestamp'])
 250
 251        # Calculate the time differences in seconds
 252        time_diffs = self._ctd_array['timestamp'].diff().dt.total_seconds()
 253
 254        # Calculate the rate of change of pressure over time (dP/dt)
 255        pressure_diffs = self._ctd_array['pressure_00'].diff()
 256        vertical_speed = pressure_diffs / time_diffs
 257
 258        # Add vertical speed to the DataFrame
 259        self._ctd_array['vertical_speed'] = vertical_speed
 260
 261        # Filter out data where the rate of change of pressure indicates upcasting or stationary periods
 262        # Assuming positive vertical speed indicates downcasting (i.e., increasing pressure)
 263        # You might need to adjust this logic based on the actual data characteristics
 264        self._ctd_array = self._ctd_array[
 265            (self._ctd_array['vertical_speed'] > 0) & (~self._ctd_array['vertical_speed'].isna())]
 266        self._ctd_array.drop('vertical_speed', axis=1)
 267
 268    def remove_non_positive_samples(self):
 269        """
 270        Iterates through the columns of the CTD data table and removes rows with non-positive values
 271        for depth, pressure, salinity, absolute salinity, or density.
 272        """
 273        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
 274            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_SAMPLES_ERROR)
 275        for column in self._ctd_array.columns:
 276            match column:
 277                case 'depth_00':
 278                    self._ctd_array = self.Utility.remove_rows_with_negative_depth(self._ctd_array)
 279                case 'pressure_00':
 280                    self._ctd_array = self.Utility.remove_rows_with_negative_pressure(self._ctd_array)
 281                case 'salinity_00':
 282                    self._ctd_array = self.Utility.remove_rows_with_negative_salinity(self._ctd_array)
 283                case 'salinityabs':
 284                    self._ctd_array = self.Utility.remove_rows_with_negative_salinityabs(self._ctd_array)
 285                case 'density':
 286                    self._ctd_array = self.Utility.remove_rows_with_negative_density(self._ctd_array)
 287        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
 288            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._REMOVE_NEGATIVES_ERROR)
 289
 290    def remove_invalid_salinity_values(self):
 291        """
 292        Removes rows with invalid values (<10) for practical salinity.
 293        """
 294        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
 295            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_SAMPLES_ERROR)
 296        for column in self._ctd_array.columns:
 297            match column:
 298                case 'salinity_00':
 299                    self._ctd_array = self.Utility.remove_rows_with_invalid_salinity(self._ctd_array)
 300        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
 301            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._REMOVE_NEGATIVES_ERROR)
 302
 303    def bin_average_pressure(self, bin_size=0.5):
 304        """
 305        Bins by pressure and averages numeric columns.
 306
 307        Parameters
 308        ----------
 309        bin_size: float
 310            Size of pressure bins, defaults to 0.5.
 311        """
 312        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
 313            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_SAMPLES_ERROR)
 314        # Check if 'Pressure_Bin' already exists and drop it if it does
 315        if 'Pressure_Bin' in self._ctd_array.columns:
 316            self._ctd_array.drop(columns=['Pressure_Bin'], inplace=True)
 317
 318        # Binning data using the specified bin size
 319        self._ctd_array['Pressure_Bin'] = (self._ctd_array['pressure_00'] // bin_size) * bin_size
 320
 321        # Identifying numeric and non-numeric columns
 322        numeric_cols = self._ctd_array.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
 323        numeric_cols.remove('pressure_00')  # Remove the original pressure column if it's still in the list
 324        non_numeric_cols = ['timestamp', 'filename', 'latitude',
 325                            'longitude']  # specify any non-numeric column you expect to handle specially
 326        # Creating aggregation dictionary
 327        agg_dict = {col: 'mean' for col in numeric_cols}
 328        agg_dict.update({col: 'first' for col in non_numeric_cols})
 329        # Aggregating data by the new pressure bins
 330        data_binned = self._ctd_array.groupby('Pressure_Bin').agg(agg_dict).reset_index(drop=True)
 331
 332        # Cleaning up DataFrame, resetting the index and column names
 333        data_binned.rename(columns={'Pressure_Bin': 'pressure_00'}, inplace=True)
 334        self._ctd_array = data_binned.copy(deep=True)
 335
 336        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
 337            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_SAMPLES_ERROR)
 338
 339    def clean(self, feature, method='autoencoder'):
 340        """
 341        Applies data cleaning methods to the specified feature using the selected method.
 342        Currently supports cleaning practical salinity using 'salinitydiff' or 'autoencoder' methods.
 343
 344        Parameters
 345        ----------
 346        feature : str
 347            The feature to clean (e.g., 'practicalsalinity').
 348            Options are 'practicalsalinity'.
 349        method : str, optional
 350            The cleaning method to apply, defaults to 'autoencoder'.
 351            Options are 'salinitydiff', 'autoencoder'.
 352        """
 353        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
 354            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_SAMPLES_ERROR)
 355        supported_features = {
 356            "practicalsalinity": "salinity_00"
 357        }
 358        supported_methods = {
 359            "salinitydiff": Calculate.calculate_and_drop_salinity_spikes(self._ctd_array),
 360            "autoencoder": self.clean_salinity_autoencoder()
 361        }
 362        if feature in supported_features.keys():
 363            if method in supported_methods.keys():
 364                self._ctd_array = supported_methods[method]
 365            else:
 366                logger.error(f"clean: Invalid method \"{method}\" not in {supported_methods.keys()}", exc_info=True)
 367        else:
 368            logger.error(f"clean: Invalid feature \"{feature}\" not in {supported_features.keys()}.", exc_info=True)
 369        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
 370            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._DATA_CLEANING_ERROR)
 371
 372    def add_absolute_salinity(self):
 373        """
 374        Calculates the absolute salinity using the TEOS-10 equations and adds it as a new column
 375        to the CTD data table. Removes rows with negative absolute salinity values.
 376        """
 377        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
 378            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_SAMPLES_ERROR)
 379        self._ctd_array.loc[self._ctd_array.index, 'salinityabs'] = Calculate.calculate_absolute_salinity(
 380            self._ctd_array)
 381        self._ctd_array = self.Utility.remove_rows_with_negative_salinityabs(self._ctd_array)
 382        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
 383            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._SALINITYABS_CALCULATION_ERROR)
 384
 385    def add_density(self):
 386        """
 387        Calculates the density using the TEOS-10 equations and adds it as a new column to the CTD
 388        data table. If absolute salinity is not present, it is calculated first.
 389        """
 390        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
 391            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_SAMPLES_ERROR)
 392        if 'salinityabs' in self._ctd_array.columns:
 393            self._ctd_array.loc[self._ctd_array.index, 'density'] = Calculate.calculate_absolute_density(
 394                self._ctd_array)
 395        else:
 396            self.add_absolute_salinity()
 397            self._ctd_array.loc[self._ctd_array.index, 'density'] = Calculate.calculate_absolute_density(
 398                self._ctd_array)
 399            self._ctd_array.drop('salinityabs')
 400            if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
 401                raise CTDError(self._filename, self._DENSITY_CALCULATION_ERROR)
 402
 403    def add_overturns(self):
 404        """
 405        Calculates density changes between consecutive measurements and identifies overturns where
 406        denser water lies above less dense water. Adds an 'overturn' column to the CTD data table.
 407        """
 408        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
 409            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_SAMPLES_ERROR)
 410        self._ctd_array = Calculate.calculate_overturns(self._ctd_array.copy())
 411
 412    def add_surface_salinity_temp_meltwater(self, start=10.0, end=12.0):
 413        """
 414        Calculates the surface salinity, temperature, and meltwater fraction and adds them as a new column to the CTD
 415        data table
 416
 417        Parameters
 418        ----------
 419        start : float, optional
 420            Minimum pressure bound, defaults to 10.0.
 421        end : float, optional
 422            Maximum pressure bound, defaults to 12.0.
 423        """
 424        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
 425            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_SAMPLES_ERROR)
 426        surface_salinity, meltwater_fraction = (Calculate.calculate_surface_salinity_and_meltwater
 427                                                (self._ctd_array, start, end))
 428        surface_temperature = (Calculate.calculate_surface_temperature(self._ctd_array, start, end))
 429        self._ctd_array = self._ctd_array.assign(surface_salinity=surface_salinity)
 430        self._ctd_array = self._ctd_array.assign(meltwater_fraction=meltwater_fraction)
 431        self._ctd_array = self._ctd_array.assign(surface_temperature=surface_temperature)
 432
 433    def add_mean_surface_density(self, start=0.0, end=100.0):
 434        """
 435        Calculates the mean surface density from the density values and adds it as a new column
 436        to the CTD data table.
 437
 438        Parameters
 439        ----------
 440        start : float, optional
 441            Depth bound, defaults to 0.
 442        end : float, optional
 443            Depth bound, default to 1.
 444        """
 445        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
 446            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_SAMPLES_ERROR)
 447        mean_surface_density = Calculate.calculate_mean_surface_density(self._ctd_array.copy(), (start, end))
 448        self._ctd_array = self._ctd_array.assign(mean_surface_density=mean_surface_density)
 449
 450    def add_mld(self, reference, method="default"):
 451        """
 452        Calculates the mixed layer depth using the specified method and reference depth.
 453        Adds the MLD and the actual reference depth used as new columns to the CTD data table.
 454
 455        Parameters
 456        ----------
 457        reference : int
 458            The reference depth for MLD calculation.
 459        method : int
 460            The MLD calculation method (default: "default").
 461        """
 462        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
 463            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_SAMPLES_ERROR)
 464        copy_ctd_array = self._ctd_array.copy()
 465        supported_methods = [
 466            "default"
 467        ]
 468        unpack = None
 469
 470        if method == "default":
 471            unpack = Calculate.calculate_mld(copy_ctd_array['density'], copy_ctd_array['depth_00'],
 472                                             reference)
 473        else:
 474            logger.error(f"add_mld: Invalid method \"{method}\" not in {supported_methods}", exc_info=True)
 475            unpack = [None, None]
 476        if unpack is None:
 477            unpack = [None, None]
 478            raise CTDError(self._filename, "MLD could not be calculated.")
 479        MLD = unpack[0]
 480        depth_used_as_reference = unpack[1]
 481        self._ctd_array.loc[self._ctd_array.index, f'MLD {reference}'] = MLD
 482        self._ctd_array.loc[
 483            self._ctd_array.index, f'MLD {reference} Actual Reference Depth'] = depth_used_as_reference
 484        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
 485            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._MLD_ERROR)
 486
 487    def plot_depth_salinity_density_mld_line(self):
 488        """
 489        Generates a plot of depth vs. salinity and density, applying LOESS smoothing to the data.
 490        Adds horizontal lines indicating the mixed layer depth (MLD) at different reference depths.
 491        Saves the plot as an image file.
 492        """
 493        df = self._ctd_array.copy()
 494        filename = self._filename
 495        plt.rcParams.update({'font.size': 16})
 496        df_filtered = df
 497        if df_filtered.isnull().values.any():
 498            df_filtered.dropna(inplace=True)  # Drop rows with NaNs
 499        df_filtered = df_filtered.reset_index(drop=True)
 500        if len(df_filtered) < 1:
 501            return
 502        surface_salinity = df_filtered.loc['surface_salinity'][0]
 503        surface_temperature = df_filtered.loc['surface_temperature'][0]
 504        meltwater_fraction = df_filtered.loc['meltwater_fraction'][0]
 505        fig, ax1 = plt.subplots(figsize=(18, 18))
 506        ax1.invert_yaxis()
 507        # Dynamically set y-axis limits based on depth data
 508        max_depth = df_filtered['depth_00'].max()
 509        ax1.set_ylim([max_depth, 0])  # Assuming depth increases downwards
 510        lowess = statsmodels.api.nonparametric.lowess
 511        salinity_lowess = lowess(df_filtered['salinity_00'], df_filtered['depth_00'], frac=0.1)
 512        salinity_depths, salinity_smooth = zip(*salinity_lowess)
 513        color_salinity = 'tab:blue'
 514        ax1.plot(salinity_smooth, salinity_depths, color=color_salinity, label='Practical Salinity')
 515        ax1.set_xlabel('Practical Salinity (PSU)', color=color_salinity)
 516        ax1.set_ylabel('Depth (m)')
 517        ax1.tick_params(axis='x', labelcolor=color_salinity)
 518        density_lowess = lowess(df_filtered['density'], df_filtered['depth_00'], frac=0.1)
 519        density_depths, density_smooth = zip(*density_lowess)
 520        ax2 = ax1.twiny()
 521        color_density = 'tab:red'
 522        ax2.plot(density_smooth, density_depths, color=color_density, label='Density (kg/m^3)')
 523        ax2.set_xlabel('Density (kg/m^3)', color=color_density)
 524        ax2.tick_params(axis='x', labelcolor=color_density)
 525        ax2.xaxis.set_major_formatter(ScalarFormatter(useOffset=False))
 526        mld_cols = []
 527        for col in df.columns:
 528            if 'MLD' in col and 'Actual' not in col:
 529                mld_cols.append(df[col])
 530        refdepth_cols = []
 531        for col in df.columns:
 532            if 'Actual' in col:
 533                refdepth_cols.append(df[col])
 534        for idx, mld_col in enumerate(mld_cols):
 535            ax1.axhline(y=mld_col.iloc[0], color='green', linestyle='--',
 536                        label=f'MLD {refdepth_cols[idx].iloc[0]} Ref')
 537            ax1.text(0.95, mld_col.iloc[0], f'MLD with respect to {refdepth_cols[idx].iloc[0]}m', va='center',
 538                     ha='right', backgroundcolor='white', color='green', transform=ax1.get_yaxis_transform())
 539        if df_filtered['overturn'].any():
 540            plt.title(
 541                f"{filename}\n Depth vs. Salinity and Density with LOESS Transform "
 542                f"\n THIS IS AN UNSTABLE WATER COLUMN "
 543                f"\n(Higher density fluid lies above lower density fluid)")
 544        else:
 545            plt.title(
 546                f"{filename}\n Depth vs. Salinity and Density with LOESS Transform \n Surface Salinity {surface_salinity}\n, Surface Temperature {surface_temperature}\n, Meltwater Fraction {meltwater_fraction}\n")
 547
 548        ax1.grid(True)
 549        lines, labels = ax1.get_legend_handles_labels()
 550        ax2_legend = ax2.get_legend_handles_labels()
 551        ax1.legend(lines + ax2_legend[0], labels + ax2_legend[1], loc='lower center', bbox_to_anchor=(0.5, -0.15),
 552                   ncol=3)
 553        plot_path = os.path.join(self._cwd, f"plots/{filename}_salinity_density_depth_plot_dual_x_axes_line.png")
 554        plot_folder = os.path.join(self._cwd, "plots")
 555        if not (os.path.isdir(plot_folder)):
 556            os.mkdir(plot_folder)
 557        plt.savefig(plot_path)
 558        plt.close(fig)
 559

 688    def _process_master_sheet(self, master_sheet_path, filename):
 689        """
 690        Extracts the date and time components from the filename and compares them with the data
 691        in the master sheet. Calculates the absolute differences between the dates and times to
 692        find the closest match. Returns the estimated latitude, longitude, and updated filename
 693        based on the closest match.
 694
 695        Parameters
 696        ----------
 697        master_sheet_path : str
 698            The path to the master sheet Excel file.
 699
 700        filename : str
 701            The filename of the RSK file.
 702
 703        Returns
 704        -------
 705        tuple
 706            A tuple containing the estimated latitude, longitude, and updated filename.
 707        """
 708
 709        def get_date_from_string(filename):
 710            try:
 711                year = filename.split('_')[1][:4]
 712                month = filename.split('_')[1][4:6]
 713                day = filename.split('_')[1][6:]
 714                hour = filename.split('_')[2][0:2]
 715                minute = filename.split('_')[2][2:4]
 716                time = f"{hour}:{minute}"
 717                return float(year), float(month), float(day), time
 718            except:
 719                return None, None, None, None
 720
 721        # Function to calculate the absolute difference between two dates
 722        def date_difference(row, target_year, target_month, target_day):
 723            return abs(row['year'] - target_year) + abs(row['month'] - target_month) + abs(
 724                row['day'] - target_day)
 725
 726        # Function to calculate the absolute difference between two times
 727        def time_difference(target_time, df_time):
 728            df_time_str = str(df_time)
 729            try:
 730                target_hour, target_minute = [int(target_time.split(':')[0]), int(target_time.split(':')[1])]
 731            except ValueError as e:
 732                raise CTDError(filename, "Malformed filename, could not parse time.")
 733            try:
 734                df_hour, df_minute = [int(df_time_str.split(':')[0]), int(df_time_str.split(':')[1])]
 735            except:
 736                # Invalid time
 737                return 1000000
 738            return abs((target_hour * 60 + target_minute) - (df_hour * 60 + df_minute))
 739
 740        # Check if the master sheet is already cached
 741        if self._cached_master_sheet.empty:
 742            # Load the master sheet and cache it
 743            logger.info("Reloading master sheet.")
 744            self._cached_master_sheet = pd.read_excel(master_sheet_path)
 745        master_df = self._cached_master_sheet
 746        # Get date and time components from the filename
 747        year, month, day, time = get_date_from_string(filename)
 748        if year is None:
 749            return None, None, None
 750        # Calculate absolute differences for each row in 'master_df'
 751        master_df['date_difference'] = master_df.apply(date_difference, args=(year, month, day), axis=1)
 752        master_df['time_difference'] = master_df['time_local'].apply(lambda x: time_difference(time, x))
 753        # Find the rows with the smallest total difference for date
 754        smallest_date_difference = master_df['date_difference'].min()
 755        closest_date_rows = master_df[master_df['date_difference'] == smallest_date_difference]
 756        # Check if time_difference returns None
 757        if closest_date_rows['time_difference'].isnull().any():
 758            closest_time_time = None
 759            closest_row_overall = closest_date_rows.iloc[0]
 760        else:
 761            # If there are multiple rows with the smallest date difference, select the row with the smallest time difference
 762            if len(closest_date_rows) > 1:
 763                try:
 764                    closest_time_row = closest_date_rows.loc[closest_date_rows['time_difference'].idxmin()]
 765                except TypeError as e:
 766                    raise CTDError(filename, "Malformed time input.")
 767                closest_row_overall = closest_time_row
 768                closest_time_time = closest_row_overall['time_local']
 769            else:
 770                closest_row_overall = closest_date_rows.iloc[0]
 771                closest_time_time = closest_row_overall['time_local']
 772        latitude = closest_row_overall['latitude']
 773        longitude = closest_row_overall['longitude']
 774        unique_id = closest_row_overall.iloc[0]
 775        RBRfilename = filename + "_gpscm"
 776        # Access the closest date components
 777        closest_date_year = closest_row_overall['year']
 778        closest_date_month = closest_row_overall['month']
 779        closest_date_day = closest_row_overall['day']
 780        # Print the closest date and time
 781        logger.warning("|-ESTIMATION ALERT-|")
 782        logger.warning("Had to guess location on file: " + filename)
 783        logger.warning("Unique ID: " + unique_id)
 784        logger.warning("Closest Date (Year, Month, Day):" + str(closest_date_year) + str(closest_date_month) + str(
 785            closest_date_day))
 786        logger.warning("Lat: " + str(latitude))
 787        logger.warning("Long: " + str(longitude))
 788        if closest_time_time:
 789            logger.warning("Closest Time:" + str(closest_time_time))
 790        logger.warning("====================")
 791        return latitude, longitude, RBRfilename
 792
 793    def get_sample_location(self, rsk, filename):
 794        """
 795        Retrieves the sample location data from the RSK file. If no location data is found,
 796        it attempts to estimate the location using the master sheet. Returns the latitude,
 797        longitude, and updated filename.
 798
 799        Parameters
 800        ----------
 801        rsk : RSK
 802            Ruskin object of the RSK file.
 803        filename : str
 804            The filename of the RSK file.
 805
 806        Returns
 807        -------
 808        tuple
 809            A tuple containing the latitude associated with the sample, longitude associated with the sample,
 810            and the filename, adds _gps if the location was in the ruskin file,
 811            _gpscm if located via mastersheet, or _gpserror if unable to locate.
 812        """
 813        # Adding geo data, assumes no drift and uses the first lat long in the file if there is one
 814        geo_data_length = len(list(itertools.islice(rsk.geodata(), None)))
 815        if geo_data_length < 1:
 816            latitude_intermediate, longitude_intermediate, filename = self._process_master_sheet(
 817                self.master_sheet_path, filename)
 818            return latitude_intermediate, longitude_intermediate, filename
 819        else:
 820            for geo in itertools.islice(rsk.geodata(), None):
 821                # Is there geo data?
 822                if geo.latitude is not None:
 823                    # If there is, is it from the southern ocean?
 824                    if not (geo.latitude > -60):
 825                        try:
 826                            latitude_intermediate = geo.latitude[0]
 827                            longitude_intermediate = geo.longitude[0]
 828                            filename += "_gps"
 829                            return latitude_intermediate, longitude_intermediate, filename
 830                        except:
 831                            latitude_intermediate = geo.latitude
 832                            longitude_intermediate = geo.longitude
 833                            filename += "_gps"
 834                            return latitude_intermediate, longitude_intermediate, filename
 835                    else:
 836                        latitude_intermediate, longitude_intermediate, filename = self._process_master_sheet(
 837                            self.master_sheet_path, filename)
 838                        return latitude_intermediate, longitude_intermediate, filename
 839                else:
 840                    return None, None, filename + 'gpserror'
 841
 842    def clean_salinity_autoencoder(self):
 843        """
 844        Cleans salinity using an LSTM autoencoder ML model.
 845        Warning: This process will bin the data every 0.5 dbar of pressure.
 846
 847        Returns
 848        -------
 849        DataFrame
 850            CTD data with clean salinity values.
 851        """
 852
 853        def loss_function(y_true, y_pred):
 854            """
 855            MAE loss with additional term to penalize salinity predictions that increase with pressure.
 856
 857            Parameters
 858            ----------
 859            y_true
 860                True salinity tensor.
 861            y_pred
 862                Predicted salinity tensor.
 863            Returns
 864            -------
 865            float
 866                Loss value.
 867            """
 868            # Assuming salinity is at index 0
 869            salinity_true = y_true[:, :, 0]
 870            salinity_pred = y_pred[:, :, 0]
 871
 872            # Calculate differences between consecutive values
 873            delta_sal_true = salinity_true[:, 1:] - salinity_true[:, :-1]
 874            delta_sal_pred = salinity_pred[:, 1:] - salinity_pred[:, :-1]
 875
 876            # Penalize predictions where salinity decreases while pressure increases
 877            penalties = tf.where(delta_sal_pred < 0, -tf.minimum(delta_sal_pred, 0), 0)
 878
 879            # Calculate mean absolute error
 880            mae = tf.reduce_mean(tf.abs(y_true - y_pred))
 881
 882            # Add penalties
 883            return mae + 6.0 * tf.reduce_mean(penalties)  # Adjust weighting of penalty as needed
 884
 885        def build_lstm_autoencoder(input_shape):
 886            """
 887            LSTM autoencoder architecture.
 888            """
 889            # Encoder
 890            encoder_inputs = Input(shape=(input_shape[0], input_shape[1]), name='encoder_inputs')
 891            encoder_lstm1 = LSTM(16, activation='tanh',
 892                                 return_sequences=True)(encoder_inputs)
 893            encoder_lstm2 = LSTM(8, activation='tanh',
 894                                 return_sequences=True)(encoder_lstm1)
 895            encoder_lstm3 = LSTM(8, activation='tanh',
 896                                 return_sequences=True)(encoder_lstm2)
 897            encoder_lstm4 = LSTM(8, activation='tanh',
 898                                 return_sequences=False)(encoder_lstm3)
 899            encoder_output = Dense(8, activation='linear')(encoder_lstm4)
 900
 901            # Decoder
 902            decoder_inputs = RepeatVector(input_shape[0])(encoder_output)
 903            decoder_lstm1 = LSTM(8, activation='tanh',
 904                                 return_sequences=True)(decoder_inputs)
 905            decoder_lstm2 = LSTM(8, activation='tanh',
 906                                 return_sequences=True)(decoder_lstm1)
 907            decoder_lstm3 = LSTM(8, activation='tanh',
 908                                 return_sequences=True)(decoder_lstm2)
 909            decoder_lstm4 = LSTM(16, activation='tanh',
 910                                 return_sequences=True)(decoder_lstm3)
 911            decoder_output = TimeDistributed(Dense(input_shape[1], activation='linear'), name='decoded_output')(
 912                decoder_lstm4)
 913
 914            autoencoder = Model(encoder_inputs, decoder_output)
 915            optimizer = Adam(learning_rate=0.03)
 916            autoencoder.compile(optimizer=optimizer, loss=loss_function)
 917            return autoencoder
 918
 919        def plot_original_data(data):
 920            filename = data['filename'].iloc[0]
 921            plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
 922            plt.scatter(data['salinity_00'], -data['depth_00'], alpha=0.6)
 923            plt.xlabel('Salinity (PSU)')
 924            plt.ylabel('Depth (m)')
 925            plt.title(f'Original Salinity vs. Depth - {filename}')
 926            plt.grid(True)
 927            plt.savefig(os.path.join('plots', f'{filename}_original.png'))
 928            xlim = plt.xlim()
 929            ylim = plt.ylim()
 930            # plt.show()
 931            plt.close()
 932            return xlim, ylim
 933
 934        def plot_predicted_data(predicted_df, xlim, ylim):
 935            filename = predicted_df['filename'].iloc[0]
 936            plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
 937            plt.scatter(predicted_df['salinity_00'], -predicted_df['depth_00'], alpha=0.6, color='red')
 938            title = f'Predicted Salinity vs. Depth - {filename}'
 939            plt.title(title)
 940            plt.xlabel('Salinity (PSU)')
 941            plt.ylabel('Depth (m)')
 942            plt.grid(True)
 943            plt.xlim(xlim)
 944            plt.ylim(ylim)
 945            plt.savefig(os.path.join('plots', f'{filename}_predicted.png'))
 946            # plt.show()
 947            plt.close()

 949        def run_autoencoder(show_plots=True):
 950            """
 951            Runs the autoencoder.
 952
 953            Returns
 954            -------
 955            DataFrame
 956                CTD data with clean salinity values.
 957            """
 958            # Preprocess data
 959            data = self._ctd_array.copy()
 960            # Binning data
 961            data.loc[:, 'Pressure_Bin'] = data['pressure_00'] // 0.25 * 0.25
 962            # Define the desired columns and their aggregation functions
 963            column_agg_dict = {
 964                "temperature_00": "mean",
 965                "pressure_00": "median",
 966                "chlorophyll_00": "mean",
 967                "seapressure_00": "median",
 968                "depth_00": "median",
 969                "salinity_00": "mean",
 970                "speedofsound_00": "mean",
 971                "specificconductivity_00": "mean",
 972                "conductivity_00": "mean",
 973                "density": "mean",
 974                "salinityabs": "mean",
 975                "timestamp": "first",
 976                "MLD_Zero": "first",
 977                "MLD_Ten": "first",
 978                "stratification": "first",
 979                "mean_surface_density": "first",
 980                "surface_salinity": "first",
 981                "surface_temperature": "first",
 982                "meltwater_fraction": "first",
 983                "longitude": "first",
 984                "latitude": "first",
 985                "overturn": "first"
 986            }
 987            # Check which columns are present in the DataFrame
 988            available_columns = {col: agg_func for col, agg_func in column_agg_dict.items() if col in data.columns}
 989            # Group by and aggregate based on the available columns
 990            data_binned = data.groupby(['filename', 'Pressure_Bin']).agg(available_columns).reset_index()
 991            # Rename the Pressure_Bin column if it exists
 992            if 'Pressure_Bin' in data_binned.columns:
 993                data_binned.rename(columns={'Pressure_Bin': 'pressure_00'}, inplace=True)
 994            # Scaling data
 995            numerical_columns = ['salinity_00']
 996            scaler = MinMaxScaler(feature_range=(-1, 1))
 997            scaled_sequence = scaler.fit_transform(data_binned[numerical_columns])
 998            if len(scaled_sequence) < 2:
 999                raise CTDError(self._filename, "Not enough values to run the autoencoder on this data.")
1000            scaled_seq = np.expand_dims(scaled_sequence, axis=0)
1001            min_pres = data_binned['depth_00'].min()
1002            max_pres = data_binned['depth_00'].max()
1003            # Calculate ranges
1004            pres_range = max_pres - min_pres
1005            epochs = int(pres_range * 18)
1006            # Build autoencoder and predict on CTD data
1007            autoencoder = build_lstm_autoencoder(scaled_seq.shape[1:])
1008            autoencoder.fit(scaled_seq, scaled_seq, epochs=epochs, verbose=0, batch_size=4)
1009            X_pred = autoencoder.predict(scaled_seq, verbose=None)
1010            # Revert scaling
1011            predicted_seq = scaler.inverse_transform(X_pred[0])
1012            data_binned['salinity_00'] = predicted_seq[:, 0]
1013            if show_plots:
1014                xlim, ylim = plot_original_data(self._ctd_array)
1015                plot_predicted_data(data_binned, xlim, ylim)
1016            data_binned = data_binned.loc[:, ~data_binned.columns.duplicated()].copy()
1017            return data_binned.reindex()
1018
1019        return run_autoencoder()

1055        def no_values_in_object(self, object_to_check):
1056            """
1057            Checks if the given object is None, empty, or has a length greater than 0.
1058            Returns True if the object has no values, False otherwise.
1059
1060            Parameters
1061            ----------
1062            object_to_check : object
1063                The object to check for values.
1064            Returns
1065            --------
1066            bool
1067                True if the object has no values, False otherwise.
1068            """
1069            if isinstance(object_to_check, type(None)):
1070                return True
1071            if object_to_check.empty:
1072                return True
1073            if len(object_to_check) > 0:
1074                return False

1076        def remove_sample_timezone_indicator(self, df):
1077            """
1078            Removes the timezone indicator (e.g., '+00:00') from the 'timestamp' column of the
1079            given DataFrame. Returns the updated DataFrame.
1080
1081            Parameters
1082            ----------
1083            df : DataFrame
1084                The DataFrame to process.
1085
1086            Returns
1087            -------
1088            DataFrame
1089                The updated DataFrame with the timezone indicator removed.
1090            """
1091            if self.no_values_in_object(df):
1092                return None
1093            if 'timestamp' in df.columns:
1094                df['timestamp'] = df['timestamp'].astype(str).str.split('+').str[0]
1095                return df
1096            else:
1097                return df

1249        @staticmethod
1250        def save_to_csv(input_df, output_file):
1251            """
1252            Renames the columns of the CTD data table based on a predefined mapping and saves the
1253            data to the specified CSV file. If the file already exists, the data is appended to it.
1254
1255            Parameters
1256            ----------
1257            input_df : DataFrame
1258                The output CSV file path.
1259            output_file : str
1260                The output CSV file path.
1261            """
1262            rsk_labels = {
1263                "temperature_00": "Temperature_(C)",
1264                "pressure_00": "Pressure_(dbar)",
1265                "chlorophyll_00": "Chlorophyll_a_(g/l)",
1266                "seapressure_00": "Sea Pressure_(dbar)",
1267                "depth_00": "Depth_(m)",
1268                "salinity_00": "Salinity_(PSU)",
1269                "speedofsound_00": "Speed of Sound_(m/s)",
1270                "specificconductivity_00": "Specific Conductivity_(S/cm)",
1271                "conductivity_00": "Conductivity_(mS/cm)",
1272                "density": "Density_(kg/m^3)",
1273                "salinityabs": "Absolute Salinity_(g/kg)",
1274                "MLD_Zero": "MLD Zero_(m)",
1275                "MLD_Ten": "MLD Ten_(m)",
1276                "stratification": "Stratification_(J/m^2)",
1277                "mean_surface_density": "Mean_Surface_Density_(kg/m^3)",
1278                "surface_salinity": "Surface_Salinity_(PSU)",
1279                "surface_temperature": "Surface_Temperature_(C)",
1280                "meltwater_fraction": "Meltwater_Fraction_(%)",
1281                "overturn": "Overturn_(<-0.05)"
1282            }
1283            data = input_df.copy()
1284            data.rename(columns=rsk_labels, inplace=True)
1285            data.reset_index(drop=True, inplace=True)
1286            # Handle CSV file reading and merging
1287            try:
1288                csv_df = pd.read_csv(output_file)
1289                csv_df.reset_index(drop=True, inplace=True)
1290            except FileNotFoundError:
1291                logger.info(f"The file {output_file} does not exist. A new file will be created.")
1292                csv_df = pd.DataFrame()
1293
1294            # Merge the existing DataFrame with the new DataFrame
1295            merged_df = pd.concat((csv_df, data), ignore_index=True)
1296            # Overwrite the original CSV file with the merged DataFrame
1297            merged_df.to_csv(output_file, index=False)

1299        @staticmethod
1300        def extract_utc_cast_time(ctdfilepath):
1301            """
1302            Function to extract the UTC cast time from a castaway file and convert it to ISO 8601 format.
1303
1304            Parameters
1305            ----------
1306            ctdfilepath : str
1307                The file path of the castaway file to extract the time from.
1308
1309            Returns
1310            -------
1311            str
1312                Cast time (UTC) of the castaway file in ISO 8601 format.
1313            """
1314            # Initialize variable to store UTC cast time
1315            cast_time_utc = None
1316            # Open the file and read line by line
1317            with open(ctdfilepath, 'r') as file:
1318                for line in file:
1319                    if line.startswith('% Cast time (UTC)'):
1320                        # Extract the UTC cast time after the comma
1321                        parts = line.strip().split(',')
1322                        if len(parts) > 1:
1323                            cast_time_str = parts[1].strip()  # Take only the datetime part
1324                            # Convert the datetime string to ISO format if possible
1325                            try:
1326                                cast_time_utc = datetime.strptime(cast_time_str, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S").isoformat()
1327                            except ValueError:
1328                                # Handle the case where date format does not match expected format
1329                                logger.error("Date format does not match expected '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'")
1330                            break  # Stop reading once the timestamp is found
1331
1332            return cast_time_utc
1333
1334        @staticmethod
1335        def extract_lat_long_castaway(ctdfilepath):
1336            """
1337            Function extract start lat/long from castaway file.
1338
1339            Parameters
1340            ----------
1341            ctdfilepath : str
1342                Filepath to castaway ctd file.
1343
1344            Returns
1345            -------
1346            tuple
1347                (latitude, longitude)
1348            """
1349            latitude = None
1350            longitude = None
1351            # Open the file and read line by line
1352            with open(ctdfilepath, 'r') as file:
1353                for line in file:
1354                    if line.startswith('% Start latitude'):
1355                        # Assume the format is '% description, latitude'
1356                        parts = line.strip().split(',')
1357                        if len(parts) > 1:
1358                            latitude = parts[1].strip()
1359                    if line.startswith('% Start longitude'):
1360                        # Assume the format is '% description, longitude'
1361                        parts = line.strip().split(',')
1362                        if len(parts) > 1:
1363                            longitude = parts[1].strip()
1364
1365            return latitude, longitude
CTD

Class representing a CTD object for processing and analyzing CTD data.

Attributes
  • master_sheet_path (str): Path to the mastersheet.
Usage

To create a CTD object for custom pipelines use the following method:

>>> my_data = CTD("example.rsk")

You can then run a CTD command on it like removing non-postive sample rows and then viewing your table

>>> my_data.remove_non_positive_samples()
>>> my_data.view_table()
Notes
  • Filenames must match a correct date, or else in instances where the mastersheet must be consulted CTDFjorder will return an error.
CTD( ctdfilepath, cached_master_sheet=Empty DataFrame Columns: [] Index: [], master_sheet_path=None) 
 95    def __init__(self, ctdfilepath, cached_master_sheet=pandas.DataFrame(), master_sheet_path = None):
 96        """
 97        Initialize a new CTD object.
 98
 99        Parameters
100        ----------
101        ctdfilepath : str
102            The file path to the RSK or Castaway file.
103        """
104        if not cached_master_sheet.empty:
105            self._cached_master_sheet = cached_master_sheet
106        if "rsk" in ctdfilepath:
107            self._rsk_file_flag = True
108            self._rsk = RSK(ctdfilepath)
109            self._filename = ('_'.join(ctdfilepath.split("/")[-1].split("_")[0:3]).split(".rsk")[0])
110            num_profiles = sum(1 for _ in self._rsk.profiles())
111            rsk_downcast_times = self._rsk.casts(Region.CAST_DOWN)
112            if num_profiles < 1:
113                self._ctd_array = np.array(self._rsk.npsamples())
114            else:
115                region = next(rsk_downcast_times)
116                start_time = region.start_time
117                end_time = region.end_time
118                try:
119                    self._ctd_array = np.array(self._rsk.npsamples(start_time, end_time))
120                except Exception:
121                    raise CTDError(self._filename, "No downcasts in file.")
122            self._ctd_array = pd.DataFrame(self._ctd_array)
123            self._original_profile = pd.DataFrame(self._ctd_array)
124        else:
125            self._rsk_file_flag = False
126            self._filename = ('_'.join(ctdfilepath.split("/")[-1].split("_")[0:3]).split(".csv")[0])
127            utc_cast_time = self.Utility.extract_utc_cast_time(ctdfilepath=ctdfilepath)
128            latitude, longitude = self.Utility.extract_lat_long_castaway(ctdfilepath=ctdfilepath)
129            try:
130                latitude = float(latitude)
131                longitude = float(longitude)
132            except:
133                latitude = None
134                longitude = None
135            # Convert UTC cast time to datetime and create timestamp column
136            start_time = pd.to_datetime(utc_cast_time)
137            # Calculate the time increments for each row
138            pd_csv_castaway = pd.read_csv(ctdfilepath, comment='%')
139            timestamps = [start_time + pd.Timedelta(seconds=0.2 * i) for i in range(len(pd_csv_castaway))]
140            header_mapping = {
141                "Pressure (Decibar)": "seapressure_00",
142                "Depth (Meter)": "depth_00",
143                "Temperature (Celsius)": "temperature_00",
144                "Conductivity (MicroSiemens per Centimeter)": "conductivity_00",
145                "Specific conductance (MicroSiemens per Centimeter)": "specificconductivity_00",
146                "Salinity (Practical Salinity Scale)": "salinity_00",
147                "Sound velocity (Meters per Second)": "speedofsound_00",
148                "latitude": "latitude",
149                "longitude": "longitude"
150            }
151            pd_csv_castaway.rename(columns=header_mapping, inplace=True)
152            # Insert the timestamp column as the first column
153            pd_csv_castaway['pressure_00'] = pd_csv_castaway['seapressure_00']
154            pd_csv_castaway['pressure_00'] += 10
155            pd_csv_castaway['conductivity_00'] /= 1000
156            pd_csv_castaway.insert(0, 'timestamp', timestamps)
157            pd_csv_castaway = pd_csv_castaway.assign(latitude=latitude)
158            pd_csv_castaway = pd_csv_castaway.assign(longitude=longitude)
159            pd_csv_castaway.drop('Density (Kilograms per Cubic Meter)', axis=1, inplace=True)
160            self._ctd_array = pd_csv_castaway
161            self._original_profile = pd_csv_castaway.copy(deep=True)
162        self.Utility = self.Utility(self._filename)
163        self._cwd = _get_cwd()
164        self.master_sheet_path = master_sheet_path
165        self._cached_master_sheet=cached_master_sheet
166        logger.info("New CTD Object Created from : " + self._filename)

Initialize a new CTD object.

Parameters
  • ctdfilepath (str): The file path to the RSK or Castaway file.

def add_location_to_table(self): 
211    def add_location_to_table(self):
212        """
213        Retrieves the sample location data from the RSK file and adds it to the CTD data table.
214        If no location data is found, it attempts to estimate the location using the master sheet.
215        """
216        # Check if file is castaway
217        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
218            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_SAMPLES_ERROR)
219        if not self._rsk_file_flag:
220            if self._ctd_array.latitude[0] == '':

222                    raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_MASTER_SHEET_ERROR)
223                else:
224                    location_data = self._process_master_sheet(self.master_sheet_path, self._filename)
225            else:
226                return
227        # Process RSK file

231            self._ctd_array = self._ctd_array.assign(latitude=location_data[0],
232                                                     longitude=location_data[1])

234            self._ctd_array.loc['latitude'] = None
235            self._ctd_array.loc['longitude'] = None
236            self._ctd_array.loc['filename'] = None
237            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_LOCATION_ERROR)

def remove_upcasts(self): 
239    def remove_upcasts(self):
240        """
241        Removes upcasts based on the rate of change of pressure over time.
242        This function calculates the vertical speed of the system through the water
243        using the derivative of pressure with respect to time. It filters out data
244        collected in the air or while stationary at the surface or bottom, and
245        separates the downcasts from upcasts.
246        """
247        # Ensure 'timestamp' is a datetime object for correct differentiation
248        if not pd.api.types.is_datetime64_any_dtype(self._ctd_array['timestamp']):
249            self._ctd_array['timestamp'] = pd.to_datetime(self._ctd_array['timestamp'])
250
251        # Calculate the time differences in seconds
252        time_diffs = self._ctd_array['timestamp'].diff().dt.total_seconds()
253
254        # Calculate the rate of change of pressure over time (dP/dt)
255        pressure_diffs = self._ctd_array['pressure_00'].diff()
256        vertical_speed = pressure_diffs / time_diffs
257
258        # Add vertical speed to the DataFrame
259        self._ctd_array['vertical_speed'] = vertical_speed
260
261        # Filter out data where the rate of change of pressure indicates upcasting or stationary periods
262        # Assuming positive vertical speed indicates downcasting (i.e., increasing pressure)
263        # You might need to adjust this logic based on the actual data characteristics
264        self._ctd_array = self._ctd_array[
265            (self._ctd_array['vertical_speed'] > 0) & (~self._ctd_array['vertical_speed'].isna())]
266        self._ctd_array.drop('vertical_speed', axis=1)

Removes upcasts based on the rate of change of pressure over time. This function calculates the vertical speed of the system through the water using the derivative of pressure with respect to time. It filters out data collected in the air or while stationary at the surface or bottom, and separates the downcasts from upcasts.

def remove_non_positive_samples(self): 
268    def remove_non_positive_samples(self):
269        """
270        Iterates through the columns of the CTD data table and removes rows with non-positive values
271        for depth, pressure, salinity, absolute salinity, or density.
272        """
273        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
274            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_SAMPLES_ERROR)
275        for column in self._ctd_array.columns:
276            match column:
277                case 'depth_00':
278                    self._ctd_array = self.Utility.remove_rows_with_negative_depth(self._ctd_array)
279                case 'pressure_00':
280                    self._ctd_array = self.Utility.remove_rows_with_negative_pressure(self._ctd_array)
281                case 'salinity_00':
282                    self._ctd_array = self.Utility.remove_rows_with_negative_salinity(self._ctd_array)
283                case 'salinityabs':
284                    self._ctd_array = self.Utility.remove_rows_with_negative_salinityabs(self._ctd_array)
285                case 'density':
286                    self._ctd_array = self.Utility.remove_rows_with_negative_density(self._ctd_array)
287        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
288            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._REMOVE_NEGATIVES_ERROR)

Iterates through the columns of the CTD data table and removes rows with non-positive values for depth, pressure, salinity, absolute salinity, or density.

def bin_average_pressure(self, bin_size=0.5): 
303    def bin_average_pressure(self, bin_size=0.5):
304        """
305        Bins by pressure and averages numeric columns.
306
307        Parameters
308        ----------
309        bin_size: float
310            Size of pressure bins, defaults to 0.5.
311        """
312        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
313            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_SAMPLES_ERROR)
314        # Check if 'Pressure_Bin' already exists and drop it if it does
315        if 'Pressure_Bin' in self._ctd_array.columns:
316            self._ctd_array.drop(columns=['Pressure_Bin'], inplace=True)
317
318        # Binning data using the specified bin size
319        self._ctd_array['Pressure_Bin'] = (self._ctd_array['pressure_00'] // bin_size) * bin_size
320
321        # Identifying numeric and non-numeric columns
322        numeric_cols = self._ctd_array.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
323        numeric_cols.remove('pressure_00')  # Remove the original pressure column if it's still in the list
324        non_numeric_cols = ['timestamp', 'filename', 'latitude',
325                            'longitude']  # specify any non-numeric column you expect to handle specially
326        # Creating aggregation dictionary
327        agg_dict = {col: 'mean' for col in numeric_cols}
328        agg_dict.update({col: 'first' for col in non_numeric_cols})
329        # Aggregating data by the new pressure bins
330        data_binned = self._ctd_array.groupby('Pressure_Bin').agg(agg_dict).reset_index(drop=True)
331
332        # Cleaning up DataFrame, resetting the index and column names
333        data_binned.rename(columns={'Pressure_Bin': 'pressure_00'}, inplace=True)
334        self._ctd_array = data_binned.copy(deep=True)
335
336        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
337            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_SAMPLES_ERROR)

Bins by pressure and averages numeric columns.

Parameters
  • bin_size (float): Size of pressure bins, defaults to 0.5.
def clean(self, feature, method='autoencoder'): 
339    def clean(self, feature, method='autoencoder'):
340        """
341        Applies data cleaning methods to the specified feature using the selected method.
342        Currently supports cleaning practical salinity using 'salinitydiff' or 'autoencoder' methods.
343
344        Parameters
345        ----------
346        feature : str
347            The feature to clean (e.g., 'practicalsalinity').
348            Options are 'practicalsalinity'.
349        method : str, optional
350            The cleaning method to apply, defaults to 'autoencoder'.
351            Options are 'salinitydiff', 'autoencoder'.
352        """
353        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
354            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_SAMPLES_ERROR)
355        supported_features = {
356            "practicalsalinity": "salinity_00"
357        }
358        supported_methods = {
359            "salinitydiff": Calculate.calculate_and_drop_salinity_spikes(self._ctd_array),
360            "autoencoder": self.clean_salinity_autoencoder()
361        }
362        if feature in supported_features.keys():
363            if method in supported_methods.keys():
364                self._ctd_array = supported_methods[method]
365            else:
366                logger.error(f"clean: Invalid method \"{method}\" not in {supported_methods.keys()}", exc_info=True)
367        else:
368            logger.error(f"clean: Invalid feature \"{feature}\" not in {supported_features.keys()}.", exc_info=True)
369        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
370            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._DATA_CLEANING_ERROR)

Applies data cleaning methods to the specified feature using the selected method. Currently supports cleaning practical salinity using 'salinitydiff' or 'autoencoder' methods.

Parameters
  • feature (str): The feature to clean (e.g., 'practicalsalinity'). Options are 'practicalsalinity'.
  • method (str, optional): The cleaning method to apply, defaults to 'autoencoder'. Options are 'salinitydiff', 'autoencoder'.

def add_density(self): 
385    def add_density(self):
386        """

388        data table. If absolute salinity is not present, it is calculated first.

398                self._ctd_array)

401                raise CTDError(self._filename, self._DENSITY_CALCULATION_ERROR)

def add_mld(self, reference, method='default'): 
450    def add_mld(self, reference, method="default"):
451        """
452        Calculates the mixed layer depth using the specified method and reference depth.
453        Adds the MLD and the actual reference depth used as new columns to the CTD data table.
454
455        Parameters
456        ----------
457        reference : int
458            The reference depth for MLD calculation.
459        method : int
460            The MLD calculation method (default: "default").
461        """
462        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
463            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._NO_SAMPLES_ERROR)
464        copy_ctd_array = self._ctd_array.copy()
465        supported_methods = [
466            "default"
467        ]
468        unpack = None
469
470        if method == "default":
471            unpack = Calculate.calculate_mld(copy_ctd_array['density'], copy_ctd_array['depth_00'],
472                                             reference)
473        else:
474            logger.error(f"add_mld: Invalid method \"{method}\" not in {supported_methods}", exc_info=True)
475            unpack = [None, None]
476        if unpack is None:
477            unpack = [None, None]
478            raise CTDError(self._filename, "MLD could not be calculated.")
479        MLD = unpack[0]
480        depth_used_as_reference = unpack[1]
481        self._ctd_array.loc[self._ctd_array.index, f'MLD {reference}'] = MLD
482        self._ctd_array.loc[
483            self._ctd_array.index, f'MLD {reference} Actual Reference Depth'] = depth_used_as_reference
484        if self.Utility.no_values_in_object(self._ctd_array):
485            raise CTDError(self._filename, self._MLD_ERROR)

Calculates the mixed layer depth using the specified method and reference depth. Adds the MLD and the actual reference depth used as new columns to the CTD data table.

Parameters
  • reference (int): The reference depth for MLD calculation.
  • method (int): The MLD calculation method (default: "default").
def plot_depth_salinity_density_mld_line(self): 
487    def plot_depth_salinity_density_mld_line(self):
488        """
489        Generates a plot of depth vs. salinity and density, applying LOESS smoothing to the data.
490        Adds horizontal lines indicating the mixed layer depth (MLD) at different reference depths.
491        Saves the plot as an image file.
492        """
493        df = self._ctd_array.copy()
494        filename = self._filename
495        plt.rcParams.update({'font.size': 16})
496        df_filtered = df
497        if df_filtered.isnull().values.any():
498            df_filtered.dropna(inplace=True)  # Drop rows with NaNs
499        df_filtered = df_filtered.reset_index(drop=True)
500        if len(df_filtered) < 1:
501            return
502        surface_salinity = df_filtered.loc['surface_salinity'][0]
503        surface_temperature = df_filtered.loc['surface_temperature'][0]
504        meltwater_fraction = df_filtered.loc['meltwater_fraction'][0]
505        fig, ax1 = plt.subplots(figsize=(18, 18))
506        ax1.invert_yaxis()
507        # Dynamically set y-axis limits based on depth data
508        max_depth = df_filtered['depth_00'].max()
509        ax1.set_ylim([max_depth, 0])  # Assuming depth increases downwards
510        lowess = statsmodels.api.nonparametric.lowess
511        salinity_lowess = lowess(df_filtered['salinity_00'], df_filtered['depth_00'], frac=0.1)
512        salinity_depths, salinity_smooth = zip(*salinity_lowess)
513        color_salinity = 'tab:blue'
514        ax1.plot(salinity_smooth, salinity_depths, color=color_salinity, label='Practical Salinity')
515        ax1.set_xlabel('Practical Salinity (PSU)', color=color_salinity)
516        ax1.set_ylabel('Depth (m)')
517        ax1.tick_params(axis='x', labelcolor=color_salinity)
518        density_lowess = lowess(df_filtered['density'], df_filtered['depth_00'], frac=0.1)
519        density_depths, density_smooth = zip(*density_lowess)
520        ax2 = ax1.twiny()
521        color_density = 'tab:red'
522        ax2.plot(density_smooth, density_depths, color=color_density, label='Density (kg/m^3)')
523        ax2.set_xlabel('Density (kg/m^3)', color=color_density)
524        ax2.tick_params(axis='x', labelcolor=color_density)
525        ax2.xaxis.set_major_formatter(ScalarFormatter(useOffset=False))
526        mld_cols = []
527        for col in df.columns:
528            if 'MLD' in col and 'Actual' not in col:
529                mld_cols.append(df[col])
530        refdepth_cols = []
531        for col in df.columns:
532            if 'Actual' in col:
533                refdepth_cols.append(df[col])
534        for idx, mld_col in enumerate(mld_cols):
535            ax1.axhline(y=mld_col.iloc[0], color='green', linestyle='--',
536                        label=f'MLD {refdepth_cols[idx].iloc[0]} Ref')
537            ax1.text(0.95, mld_col.iloc[0], f'MLD with respect to {refdepth_cols[idx].iloc[0]}m', va='center',
538                     ha='right', backgroundcolor='white', color='green', transform=ax1.get_yaxis_transform())
539        if df_filtered['overturn'].any():
540            plt.title(
541                f"{filename}\n Depth vs. Salinity and Density with LOESS Transform "
542                f"\n THIS IS AN UNSTABLE WATER COLUMN "
543                f"\n(Higher density fluid lies above lower density fluid)")
544        else:
545            plt.title(
546                f"{filename}\n Depth vs. Salinity and Density with LOESS Transform \n Surface Salinity {surface_salinity}\n, Surface Temperature {surface_temperature}\n, Meltwater Fraction {meltwater_fraction}\n")
547
548        ax1.grid(True)
549        lines, labels = ax1.get_legend_handles_labels()
550        ax2_legend = ax2.get_legend_handles_labels()
551        ax1.legend(lines + ax2_legend[0], labels + ax2_legend[1], loc='lower center', bbox_to_anchor=(0.5, -0.15),
552                   ncol=3)
553        plot_path = os.path.join(self._cwd, f"plots/{filename}_salinity_density_depth_plot_dual_x_axes_line.png")
554        plot_folder = os.path.join(self._cwd, "plots")
555        if not (os.path.isdir(plot_folder)):
556            os.mkdir(plot_folder)
557        plt.savefig(plot_path)
558        plt.close(fig)

Generates a plot of depth vs. salinity and density, applying LOESS smoothing to the data. Adds horizontal lines indicating the mixed layer depth (MLD) at different reference depths. Saves the plot as an image file.
